question.text: What minimum size of aluminum TW75 conductor would be permitted for a single-phase 120/240 volt 400 ampere residential service if the service raceway is rigid PVC conduit?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-004, 8-106(1) and Table 4; 5% of 400 A = 400 x 0.05 = 20 A (8-106(1); Minimum Ampacity of conductor = 400 - 20 = 380 A (Table 4 = 750 kcmil).

question.text: If you have a 2000 amp wye-connected subservice to be wired that is operating at less than 150 volts to ground, what is needed?
What is the current-carrying capacity of eight #1/0 RW90XLPE conductors when installed in a run of rigid conduit?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-004 and 4-006(2) and Tables 2 and 5C; Ampacity of #1/0 RW90XLPE - 170 A (Table 2); Correction Factor - 0.7 (Table 5C), Ampacity - 170 x 0.7 = 119 A

question.text: What is the minimum ampacity for a neutral conductor feeding a 700 amp load with no fluorescent lighting or non-linear loads?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 4-024; Minimum neutral ampacity = 100% of first 200 A + (0.7 of remainder) = 200 + (0.7 X 500) = 550A

question.text: What is the minimum ampacity for a neutral conductor feeding a 600 amp load with no fluorescent lighting and 100A of non-linear loads?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 4-024; Minimum neutral ampacity = 100% of first 200 A + non-linear loads + (0.7 of remainder - non-linear loads) = 200 + 100 + (0.7 X 300) = 510A

question.text: For the store shown in the drawing, what is the minimum size of service equipment?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 8-210 and 8-212; Total length of showcases = 7 + 4 + 4 = 15; Total showcase load = 15 x 100 = 1500 W; Length of wall case = 13 m; Wall case load = 13 x 70 = 910 W; Sign Load = 1000 W; Outside Lighting = 1500 W; Other store loads = 8000 W; Total store load = 12910 W; Load in amps = 12910 / 240 = 53.79 A.

question.text: An apartment building is to be wired for general lighting and appliances.  There are 12 apartments in the building, each with the dimensions of 9 m X 11 m. Each apartment is equipped with a 10 kW electric range.   Provision is made in the common areas of the apartment building for forty 100 W lamps, 5000 W for the furnace, three-5.5 kW dryers and four-11 amp, 120 V circuits for washers. The supply voltage for the building is 120/208 V, 3-phase, 4-wire. Using R90(XLPE) conductors in a conduit, what is the minimum size of conductor required to feed the panel in each suite if the suite panels are to be single-phase panels?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 8-202(1)(a); Area of apartment suite = 9 x 11 = 99 m²; 1st 45 m² of area = 3500 W; Next 45 m² of area = 1500 W; Remaining area = (99 m² - 90 m²) = 9 m² = 1000 W; Range = 6000 W; Total load = 12,000 W; Suite calculated load = 12,000 / (208) = 57.7; Minimum Suite Ampacity = 60 A (8-202 (1)(b)); and Conductor Size = #6 (Table 2).

question.text: An apartment building is to be wired for general lighting and appliances. There are 12 apartments in the building, each apartment's dimensions are 9 m X 11 m. Each apartment is equipped with a 10 kW electric range. Provision is made in the common areas of the apartment building for forty 100 W lamps, 5000 W for the furnace, three-5.5 kW dryers and four-11 amp, 120 V circuits for washers. The supply voltage for the building is 120/208 V, 3-phase, 4-wire. Using R90(XLPE) conductors in a conduit, what is the minimum size of conductor required to feed the panel in each suite if the suite panels are to be single-phase panels?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 8-202(1)(a); Area of apartment suite = 9 x 11 = 99 m²; 1st 45 m² of area = 3500 W; - Next 45 m² of area = 1500 W; Remaining area = (99 m² - 90 m²) = 9 m² = 1000 W; Range = 6000 W; Total load = 12,000 W; Suite calculated load = 12,000 / (208) = 57.7; Minimum Suite Ampacity = 60 A (8-202 (1)(b)); and Conductor Size = #6 (Table 2).

question.text: A 150 square-metre gas-heated home has a 10,000 watt electric range, 5000 watt clothes dryer and 4000 watt electric water heater. If the service supply is 120/240 V, 1-phase, 3-wire, what is the calculated demand on the service?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 8-200(1)(a); 1st 90 m² of area = 5000 W; Remaining 150 m² - 90 m² = 60 ² = 1000 W; Range Load = 6000 W; Additional loads - dryer = 5000 x 0.25 = 1250 W; Water heater = 4000 x 0.25 = 1000 W; Total Watts = 14250 W; and Calculated Demand Amps = 14250 / 240 = 59.4 A.

question.text: When terminating on the main breaker, what is the minimum size RW90XLPE conductor to be used when it is installed in a run of EMT for a 125 A, 120/240 V residential service combination breaker panel?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-004 and 4-006(1) and Table 2; Minimum conductor size = 1 AWG (Table 2, 75°C Column); Note: All circuit breakers have 75°C conductor termination rating;.

question.text: What is the maximum number of supply services of the same voltage that can be run to an industrial mall with 10 separate units?

An apartment building has 12 suites. Each suite is has dimensions of 9 m x 11 m along with a 10 kW electric range. The house loads are: 4000 W lighting; 5000 heating; 3 - 5.5 kW dryers; & 4 - 11 A, 120 V washer circuits? The supply voltage for the building is 120/208 V, 3-phase, 4-wire. What is the minimum size of the main RW90XLPE service conductors run in rigid PVC conduit for termination on the main circuit breaker for the building?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-006(1) and 8-202; Area of apartment suite = 9 x 11 = 99 ²; 1st 45 ² of area = 3500 W; Next 45 ² of area = 1500 W; Remaining area = (99 - 90) = 9 ² = 1000 W; Range = 6000 W; Total suite load - 12 000 W (Suite Load is non-continuous (Rule 8-202(2)); House Loads or Common Area Loads: Lighting - 4000 W; Heating - 5000 W; Dryers - 3 x 5500 = 16500 W; Washers - 4 x 11 x 120 = 5280 W; Total Calculated House Load in Watts = 30780 W; Service Size (Rule 8-202(3)); Largest Suite Load @ 100% = 12000 W; Next 2 largest Suite Loads = 2 x 12,000 x 0.65 = 15600 W; Next 2 Largest Suite Loads = 2 x 12,000 x 0.4 = 9600 W; Remaining (12 - 5 = 7) Suite Loads = 7 x 12,000 x 0.25 = 21000 W; Total suite load - 58200 W House Load @ 75% (load is continuous) = 30780 x 0.75 x 1.25 = 28856.3 W; Total Apartment Building Calculated Watts = 87056.3 W; Minimum Conductor Amps = 87056.3 / (208 x 1.73) = 241.9 A; Minimum Conductor Size = 250 kcmil.

question.text: What is the minimum size of RW90XLPE Al conductor allowed 120/240 V, 200 A residential service, where the combination panel has main breaker and the service conduit is rigid PVC conduit?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-004 and 4-006(1) and Table 4, minimum conductor size = 250 kcmil (75ºC column).

question.text: What is the minimum size of service equipment for a duplex with the following loads shown in the table below?
question.reference: Unit #1 Area = (5000 + 1000) = 6000 W; Electric Heating = 10,000 + (2000 x .75) = 11,500 W; Range = 6000 W; -Water Heater = 4500 x 0.25 = 1125 W; Dryer = 5760 x 0.25 = 1440 W; Total = 26,065 W; Total less electric heat = 26,065 - 11,500 = 14,565 W; Unit #2 Area = 5000 W; Electric Heating = 8000 W; Range = 6000 W; Water Heater = 4500 x 0.25 = 1125 W; Dryer = 5760 x 0.25 = 1440 W; Total 21,565 W; Total less electric heat = 21,565 - 8000 = 13,565 W; Size of Service = largest unit at 100% = 14,565 W; 2nd largest unit at 65% = 13,565 x 0.65 = 8817.3 W; Electric Heating = 10,000 + (10,000 x 0.75) = 17,500 W; Total watts = 40,882.3; Amps = 40,882.3 / 240 = 170.3 A. Please refer to Rule 8-200.

question.text: A 170 square-metre gas-heated home has a 9500 watt electric range, 5550 watt clothes dryer and 4500 watt electric water heater. If the service supply is 120/240 V, 1-phase, 3-wire, what is the calculated demand on the service?
question.reference: *Please refer to Rule 8-200(1)(a); 1st 90 ² of area = 5000 W; Remaining = 170 - 90 = 80 ² = 1000 W; Range Load = 6000 W; Additional loads: Dryer = 5550 x 0.25 = 1387.5 W; Water heater = 4500 x 0.25 = 1125 W; Total Watts = 14,512.5 W; and Calculated Demand Amps = 14,512.5 / 240 = 60.4 A.

question.text: An apartment building has10 suites, each with the dimensions of 9 m X 11 m. Each suite is equipped with an 8 kW electric range. question.text: An apartment building has 10 suites, each with the dimensions of 9 m X 11 m. Each suite is equipped with an 8 kW electric range. question.reference: Please refer to Rule 8-202;1st 45 m² of area = 3500 W; Next 45 m² of area = 1500 W; Remaining area = (99 - 90) = 9 m² = 1000 W;Range = 6000 W;Total load = 12,000 W;House Loads: Lighting - 6000 W; Heating - 5000 W; Dryers - 3 x 5500 = 16,500 W; Washers - 3 x 11 x 120 = 3960 W;Total Calculated House Load in Watts = 31,460 W;Total Load = 31,460 x 1.25 = 39,325 W;Largest Suite Load @ 100% = 12,000 W;Next 2 largest Suite Loads = 2 x 12,000 x 0.65 = 15,600 W;Next 2 Largest Suite Loads = 2 x 12,000 x 0.4 = 9600 W;Remaining (10 - 5 = 5) Suite Loads = 5 x 12,000 x 0.25 = 15,000 W;House Load @ 75% (load is continuous) = 39,325 x 0.75 = 29,494 W;Total Calculated Watts = 81,694 W; Minimum Conductor Amps = 81,694 / 240 = 340 A; Minimum Conductor Size = 500 kcmil.

question.text: The calculated 3-phase, 600 volt demand load for a machine shop is 384 kW. What is the minimum size electrical service for this shop when the service conductors are to be run in single conductor RA90 cable in free air?

question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-004 and 4-006(1) and Table 2; Minimum ampacity of one conductor = Total Amps / Number of Conductors = 1200 / 5 = 240 A; Minimum Conductor Size = 250 kcmil (Table 2, 75°C column); Note: All circuit breakers have 75°C conductor termination rating.;

question.text: What is the maximum size circuit breaker that can be used to protect a 150 kVA, dry-type, 600-120/208 V, 3-phase, 4-wire secondary transformer?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 26-256(1) and (3); Primary Winding Amps = (150 x 1000) / (600 x 1.73) = 144.5; Maximum Primary Circuit Breaker Size = 144.5 x 1.25 = 180.6; and Table 13 = 200 A.

question.text: What is the maximum size of non-time-delay fuse permitted to be used to protect a 25 kVA, 600-120/208 V, 3-phase 4-wire dry-type transformer?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 26-256(1) and (3); Primary Winding Amps = (25 x 1000) / (600 x 1.73) = 24; Maximum Primary Non-Time-Delay Fuse Size = 24 x 1.25 = 30; and Table 13 = 30 A.

question.text: What is the maximum size of non-time-delay fuse permitted to be used to protect a 25 kVA, 600-120/208 V, 3-phase 4-wire dielectric liquid-filled transformer?

question.text: What is the maximum size of non-time-delay fuse permitted to be used to protect a 37.5 kVA, 600-120/240 V, 1-phase 3-wire dry-type transformer?

question.text: What is the maximum size of non-time-delay fuse permitted to be used to protect a 25 kVA, 600-120/240 V, 1-phase 3-wire dielectric liquid-filled transformer?

question.text: When connecting a 100 ampere lighting panel to an 800 ampere splitter, what is required?

option: a conduit nipple and conductors with an 800 ampere rating
conductors that are less than 25 feet long
overcurrent protection on the supply side of the panel
conductors not less than 1/4 the rating of the feeders.

question.text: A fuse has the following stamped on the body of the fuse, "600 V, HRCII, 200 kAIC". What do the initials kAIC stand for?
When connecting a 200 ampere lighting panel to an 800 ampere splitter, what is required?

option: a conduit nipple and conductors with an 800 ampere rating
conductors that are less than 25 feet long
overcurrent protection on the supply side of the panel
conductors not less than 1/3 of the rating of the feeders.

question.text: What have HRC fuses been developed to do in an electrical distribution system?

option: interrupt higher fault currents than code fuses
increase the available fault current in a circuit
in combination, will decrease the interrupting rating of a circuit-breaker

question.text: In an electrical equipment room containing equipment rated at more than 1200 A, it is not possible to exit the room without going past a piece of equipment that could fail. What is the minimum allowable working space around that equipment?
What is the continuous operation rating of fused switches and circuit breakers that are not marked as suitable for continuous operation at 80% or 100%?
What is the maximum volts-to-ground that plug fuses can be used as protection on?
Which of the following electrical systems require ground fault detection?
What is the calculated size of service equipment for a duplex with the following loads as shown in the table below?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 8-200. Unit #1 Area = 6000 W;Range = 6000 W;Water Heater = 4500 x .25 = 1125 W;Dryer = 6000 x .25 = 1500 W;Total less electric heat = 14,625 W;Unit #2 Area = 5000 W;Range = 6000 W;Water Heater = 4500 x .25 = 1125 W;Dryer = 6000 x .25 = 1500 W;Total less electric heat = 13,625 W;Size of Service largest unit at 100% = 14,625 W;2nd largest unit at 65% = 13,625 x .65 = 8856 W;Electric Heating = 10,000 + (14,000 x .75) = 20,500 W;Total watts = 43,981;Amps = 43,981 W / 240 = 183.3 A.

question.text: What is the calculated size of service equipment for a duplex with the following loads as shown in the table below?
question.reference: Unit #1 Area= 5000 W; Electric Heating= 9000 W; Range= 6000 W; Water Heater= 3000 x .25= 750 W; Dryer= 5700 x .25= 1425 W; Total= 22,175 W; Total less electric heat= 22,175 - 9000= 13,175 W; Unit #2 Area= 5000 W; Electric Heating= 7000 W; Range= 6000 W; Water Heater= 3000 x .25= 750 W; Dryer= 5700 x .25= 1425 W; Total 20,175 W; Total less electric heat= 20,175 - 7000= 13,175 W; Size of Service= largest unit at 100%= 13,175 W; 2nd largest unit at 65%= 13,175 x .65= 8564 W; Electric Heating= 10,000 + (6000 x .75)= 14,500 W; Total watts= 36,239; Amps= 36,239 / 240= 151 A. Please refer to Rule 8-200.

question.text: Which of the following installation methods is correct when we want to prevent sheath currents from flowing in a single conductor metallic jacketed cable?

option: ground both the load and supply ends
isolate the load end and ground the supply end
isolate both the load and supply ends
use ground bushings on both ends of the cable.

question.reference: Please refer to Appendix B Note to Rule 4-010.

question.text: What is the minimum headroom required when installing a panelboard?
What switch is not permitted for either establishing or interrupting the flow of current in a circuit?
What is the recommended tightening torque that should be applied to the recessed allen screw in a mechanical lug for the termination of a 400 kcmil T90 Nylon conductor?
What is the maximum rating of a temporary construction site service when mounted on a single pole?
Which of the following wiring methods is not permitted for branch circuits used in temporary wiring?

option: nonmetallic sheathed cable of the NMD Type
flexible cord approved for extra hard usage
flexible cord approved for hard usage.

question.text: 5-15 R receptacles have been installed on a temporary construction site and are to be used for the connection of plug in temporary lighting. How are these 5-15 R receptacles to be protected?

option: 15 amp overcurrent device with GFCI protection
15 amp overcurrent device with AFCI protection

question.text: Which of the following is a requirement for electrical equipment used for service entrance use in temporary installations?

option: it must be installed as part of the permanent wiring system
it must be installed in a temporary building without exception
it must not be in a locked enclosure
it must be accessible to authorized persons only.

question.text: What is the requirement for a temporary service installation?
What is the minimum size of TW75 conductor that can be installed in a run of EMT that is used to supply a 208 V, 3-phase, 25 kVAR dry-type capacitor that is protected by a circuit breaker?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 4-006(1) and 26-208(1); Capacitor Amps = (25 x 1000) / (208 x 1.73) = 69.4; Minimum Conductor Amps = 69.4 x 1.35 = 93.8; and Table 2 = #3 AWG.

question.text: What is the minimum size of TW75 conductor that can be installed in a run of EMT that is used to supply a 600 V, 1-phase, 25 kVAR dry-type capacitor?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-000 and 26-208(1); Capacitor Amps = (25 x 1000) / (600) = 41; Minimum Conductor Amps = 41.7 x 1.35 = 56.3; and Table 2 = #6 AWG.

question.text: What is the maximum size of circuit breaker that can be used to protect a 208 V, 3-phase, 25 kVAR dry-type capacitor?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 26-210; Capacitor Amps = (25 x 1000) / (208 x 1.73) = 69.5; Maximum Overcurrent Device Size = 69.5 x 2.5 = 173.7; and Table 13 = 150 A.

question.text: What is the maximum size of non-time delay fuses that can be used to protect a 208 V, 3-phase, 25 kVAR dry-type capacitor?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 26-210; Capacitor Amps = (25 x 1000) / (208 x 1.73) = 69.5; Maximum Overcurrent Device Size = 69.5 x 2.5 = 173.7; and Table 13 = 150 A.

question.text: What is the maximum size of non-time delay fuses that can be used to protect a 600 V, 1-phase, 25 kVAR dry-type capacitor?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 26-210; Capacitor Amps = (25 x 1000) / (600) = 41.7; Maximum Overcurrent Device Size = 41.7 x 2.5 = 104.25; and Table 13 = 100 A.

question.text: What is the minimum size of TW75 conductor that can be installed in a run of EMT that is used to supply a 600 V, 3-phase, 20 kVAR Dry-Type Capacitor?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 4-006 and 26-208(1); Capacitor Amps = (20 x 1000) / (600 x 1.73) = 19.3; Minimum Conductor Amps = 19.3 x 1.35 = 26; and Table 2 = #10 AWG.

question.text: An individual disconnecting means for a capacitor is not necessary for a capacitor that meets the following requirement?

option: connected on the load side of a motor overcurrent device
part of a power factor correction network
connected in series with a motor.

question.text: What is the minimum current rating of a capacitor feeder or branch circuit conductors?
What is the minimum size of R90 conductor that can be installed in a run of EMT that is used to supply a 600 V, 3-phase, 25 kVAR dry-type capacitor?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-006(2) and 26-208 (1); Capacitor Amps = (25 x 1000) / (600 x 1.73) = 24; Minimum Conductor Amps = 24 x 1.35 = 32.4; and Table 2 = #10 AWG.

question.text: What is the maximum size of non-time delay fuses that can be used to protect a 600 V, 3-phase, 25 kVAR dry-type capacitor?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 26-210; Capacitor Amps = (25 x 1000) / (600 x 1.73) = 24; Maximum Overcurrent Device Size = 24 x 2.5 = 60; and Table 13 = 60 A.

question.text: A three-phase capacitor bank is rated at 60 amp at 600 V. What is the minimum size three-wire TECK90 cable that can be used to supply the bank?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-006(2) and 26-208(1); Capacitor Conductor amps = Capacitor's FLA x 135% = 60 x 1.35 = 81 A; Table 2 = # 4 AWG.

question.text: A 240 volt, 1-phase, 60 Hz motor has a lagging power factor of 80% when drawing 23 amp from the line. Ignoring the efficiency of the motor, what size of capacitor will be needed to correct the circuit power factor to unity?
question.reference: Please refer to KVA of motor = 23 x 240 = 5520; kW of motor = 5520 x 0.8 = 4416; Size of Capacitor (√(5520² - 4416²)) = 3.3 kVAR.

question.text: What is the maximum current-carrying capacity of a feeder consisting of four 500 kcmil RW90XLPE in a run of EMT, in a 3-phase, 4-wire system, run across the ceiling of a boiler room, with an ambient temperature of 50ºC?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 4-004 and Table 2 and Table 5A; Conductor Ampacity = 430 (Table 2); Correction Factor = 0.82 (Table 5A); and 430 x 0.82 = 352.6 A.

question.text: Under what condition is the overcurrent device protecting a panelboard allowed to be greater than the rating of the panelboard?

option: under no condition would this be allowed
if pony panel boards are installed to increase the number of available branch circuits
if the panelboard construction allows for a fitted dead-front covering
if 90% of the circuit breakers in the panelboard are connected to motor branch circuits.

question.text: What is the minimum amount of headroom required in working spaces around elevator controllers, disconnecting means and other electrical equipment?
If you have a 1000 amp wye-connected subservice to be wired that is operating at 347/ 600 V, 3-phase, what is needed?

A 600-120/208 V transformer is protected on the primary side by 100-amp fuses. A lighting panel is installed on the secondary side without secondary overcurrent protection. What is the minimum standard size panel which may be installed?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 14-606(2); Minimum Panel Amps = Primary Fuse Rating x (primary volts / secondary volts) = 100 x (600 / 208) = 288 A

question.text: A 600-120/208 V transformer is protected on the primary side by 70-amp fuses. A lighting panel is installed on the secondary side without secondary overcurrent protection. What is the minimum standard size panel that may be installed?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 14-606(2); Minimum Panel Amps = Primary Fuse Rating x (primary volts / secondary volts) = 70 x (600 / 208) = 201.9 A.

question.text: A 600-120/208 V transformer is protected on the primary side by 175 A fuses. A lighting panel is installed on the secondary side without secondary overcurrent protection. What is the minimum standard size panel which may installed?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 14-606(2); Minimum Panel Amps = Primary Fuse Rating x (primary volts / secondary volts) = 175 x (600 / 208) = 504 A.

question.text: What is the minimum working space required when troubleshooting at a live 60 amp, 120/208 V, 3-phase electrical panel?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 2-308(3) and Table 56.

question.text: What is the minimum working space required when troubleshooting at a live 600 amp, 347/600 V, 3-phase electrical panel?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 2-308(3) and Table 56.

question.text: An electrical room for a 4000 amp switchboard must have what minimum size of path to the nearest exit from anywhere in the room?
What is required when connecting a 200 ampere lighting panel to an 600 amp splitter in a commercial mall?

option: conduit nipple and conductors with an 800 ampere rating
conductors that are less than 25 feet long
overcurrent protection on the supply side of the panel
conductors not less than 1/3 of the rating of the splitter.

question.text: When a circuit breaker marked for continuous operation at 80%, is used as the type of overcurrent protection for a consumer's service, how is the circuit conductor to be sized?

option: 70% of the service overcurrent device's rating
80% of the service overcurrent device's rating
100% of the service overcurrent device's rating
125% of the service overcurrent device's rating.

question.text: What is the maximum voltage drop permitted in an industrial 600 volt, 3-phase,4-wire feeder?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 8-102(1)(c), Volts drop = System Volts x % voltage drop = 600 x 0.03 = 18 V.

question.text: Where flexible cord or cable is used to supply portable switchboards on stage, which of the following types is suitable?
When wiring from a splitter box to a single set of overcurrent devices, what is the maximum allowable length of reduced tap conductors?

An enclosure for a 100 amp circuit breaker is fed from a 400 amp splitter.  What is the minimum size of RW90XLPE conductor that is can be used when installed in 5 m of EMT between the splitter and the breaker enclosure?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 14-100(c) and 4-006(1) and Table 2; Ampacity of RW90XLPE - 400 / 3 = 133 A;  Size of RW90XLPE - #0 (Table 2).

question.text: What ampacity Tables should be used for 347/600 V, 3-phase, 4-wire feeder using four #2 RW90XLPE copper conductors installed in a raceway?
What is the maximum voltage drop permitted in a commercial 120/208 volt, 3-phase, 4-wire feeder?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 8-102(1)(c); Volts drop = System Volts x % voltage drop = 208 x 0.03 = 6.24 V

question.text: What procedure is to be followed when sheath currents in single conductor RA90 feeder cables are interrupted?

option: the cable sheaths may be used for bonding
the feeder must carry a separate bonding conductor
aluminum plates are installed at both ends of the cables.

question.reference: Please refer to Rules 10-304(2( and the Appendix B Note to Rule 4-010.

question.text: A 600 A, 347/600 V, 3-phase feeder is to be run using 3 conductors per phase.  What is the minimum size of RW90EP conductor and conduit that can be used if each set is to be run in a separate conduit?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-004 and 12-108(1) & Tables 2 & 6; Minimum ampacity of one conductor = Total Amps / Number of Conductors - 600 / 3 = 200; Minimum Conductor Size - #3/0;  Minimum number of conductors - 4 (3-phase with 2 voltages (347/600).

question.text: A 347/600 volt, 3-phase feeder consisting of three 500 kcmil R90XLPE; one #3/0 R90XLPE neutral conductor; one #2 TW75 bonding conductor is run in a rigid PVC conduit . What is the maximum ampacity rating of the feeder?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 4-004(14) and Table 2; Ampacity of 500 kcmil R90XLPE = 380 A

question.text: A 347/600 volt, 3-phase feeder consisting of three 500 kcmil R90(XLPE); one #3/0 R90(XLPE) neutral conductor; one #2 TW75 bonding conductor is run in a rigid PVC conduit. What is the maximum ampacity rating of the #3/0 R90XLPE neutral conductor?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 4-004(14) and Table 2; Ampacity of #3/0 R90XLPE - 200 A.

question.text: What is the minimum size of single-conductor RA90 cable that can be used to feed a 2000 A, 600 V, 3-phase MCC, if the cable is to be run in free air with 4 cables per phase?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-004 and 4-006(2) and Table 1; Minimum ampacity of one conductor = Total Amps / Number of Conductors = 2000 / 4 = 500 A; Minimum Conductor Size = 350 kcmil.

question.text: What is the current carrying capacity of a conductor required to feed a 60 ampere fusible switch from a 400 amp splitter if the switch is located at least 3.5 m away from the splitter?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 14-100(c); Minimum tap conductor size = amps of feeder conductor / 3 = 400 / 3 = 133.3 A.

question.text: A 2 m length of 3 - conductor AC90 cable feeds a combination motor starter tapped from a 400 ampere splitter to control a 20 hp, 600 V, 3-phase squirrel-cage motor. What is the minimum size of AC90 cable that can be used?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 28-106 and 28-110(2)(a) and Tables 2 and 44; Motor fla - 22 A; Minimum Motor Conductor Amps - motor fla x 1.25 = 22 x 1.25 = 27.5 A; Minimum Conductor Size - 12 AC90; Minimum tap conductor size - 12 AC90.

question.text: Three - #3/0 R90XLPE, one - #3/0 R90XLPE neutral conductor and one - #6 TW75 bonding conductor is to be run in the rigid PVC conduit. What is the maximum ampacity rating for the #6 TW75 bonding conductor?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 10-814 and Table 16.

question.text: Three - #3/0 R90XLPE, one - #3/0 R90XLPE neutral conductor and one - #6 TW75 bonding conductor is to be run in the rigid PVC conduit. What is the maximum ampacity rating for the three #3/0  RW90(XLPE) conductors?
question.reference: Please refer to 4-004(14) and Table 2; Ampacity of #3/0 R90(XLPE) = 225 A.

question.text: A 800 A, 347/600 V, 3-phase feeder is to be run using four conductors per phase, and terminating on fusible switch rated at 75°C.  What is the minimum size of RW90EP conductor and conduit that can be used if each set is to be run in a separate conduit?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-004, 4-006, 12-108(1) and Tables 2 & 6; Minimum ampacity of one conductor = Total Amps / Number of Conductors = 800 / 4 = 200; Minimum Conductor Size = #3/0 (75°C column)

question.text: What is the minimum size of single-conductor RA90 aluminum cable that can be used to feed a 2000 A, 600 V, 3-phase MCC, if the cable is to be run in free air with 4 cables per phase and one end terminates on a circuit breaker?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-004 and 4-006(1) and Table 3; Minimum ampacity of one conductor = Total Amps / Number of Conductors = 2000 / 4 = 500; Minimum Conductor Size = 600 kcmil;  Note: All circuit breakers have 75°C conductor termination rating.;

question.text: What is the minimum size of single-conductor RA90 cable that can be used to feed a 2000 A, 600 V, 3-phase MCC if the cable is to be run in free-air with 5 cables per phase?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-004 and 4-006(2) and Table 1; Minimum ampacity of one conductor = Total Amps / Number of Conductors - 2000 / 5 = 400; Minimum Conductor Size - 4/0 AWG.

question.text: What is the current carrying capacity of a conductor required to feed a 60 ampere switch from a 400 amp splitter if the switch is located less than 2.5 m away from the splitter?
What is the current carrying capacity of a conductor required to feed a 100 amp switch from a 400 amp splitter if the switch is located at least 3.5 m away from the splitter?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 14-100(c); Minimum tap conductor size = amps of feeder conductor / 3 = 400 / 3 = 133.3 A.

question.text: A 800 A, 347/600 V, 3-phase feeder is to be run using 3 conductors per phase.  What is the minimum size of RW90EP conductor and conduit that can be used?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 4-006(2) and Tables 2 and 6; Load in amps / number of conductors per phase - 800 /3 = 267 A; Conductor Size - 250 kcmil; Minimum number of conductors - 4 (3-phase with 2 voltages (347/600); Conduit Size = 78.

question.text: Which of the following installation methods is correct when we want to reduce the heating in the metallic sheath caused by the sheath currents flowing in a single conductor metallic jacketed cable.

option: ground both the load and supply ends
reduce the ampacity rating of the cable
isolate both the load and supply ends
use ground bushings on both ends of the cable.

question.text: Where is the disconnecting means for a transformer to be located?

option: in both the primary and secondary circuit

question.text: Where are instrument transformers that are used for metering and accessible to unauthorized persons to be located within, commercial and industrial installations?

option: be made inaccessible to unauthorized persons
have additional bonding jumpers for extra safety
be signed so as to be clear to all.

question.text: What type of loads can a delta-wye transformer supply?

option: either three-phase, three or four-wire loads

question.text: You have to size a transformer for a load of 45 amps at 480 volts, single-phase, 2-wire, what size of transformer is needed?
question.reference: Minimum kVA = (E(Line) x I(Line)) / 1000 = (480 x 45) / 1000 = 21.6 kVA.

question.text: You have two transformers having a rating of 150 kVA each at 600 V. If the transformers are connected in a open delta configuration, what is the rating of the transformer configuration?
question.reference: Total kVA of Transformer bank = 150 x 2 = 300; Total kVA of open delta configuration = 86.6% of total kVA of transformer bank; Open Delta kVA rating = 300 x 0.866 = 260.

question.text: You have two transformers having a rating of 75 kVA each at 120/208 V. If the transformers are connected in a open delta configuration, what is the rating of the transformer configuration?
question.reference: Total kVA of Transformer bank = 75 x 2 = 150; Total kVA of open delta configuration = 86.6% of total kVA of transformer bank; Open Delta kVA rating = 150 x 0.866 = 130 kVA.

question.text: Which one of the following diagrams is correct for a Wye - Delta Transformer Configuration?
What does "H"represent on a transformer diagram?
Which of the following diagrams is correct for a series low voltage connection for a Delta - Wye connected transformer?
Which one of the diagrams below is the correct diagram to obtain only 60 volts from a transformer rated at 240-120/60 volts?
Which of the following is the 3-phase Delta-Delta configuration shown in the drawing?
Which one of the diagrams below is the correct diagram to obtain only 240 volts from a transformer rated at 480-240/120 volts?
In the transformer circuit illustrated, the transformer has a 4:1 ratio. What would the voltage reading on the meter be?
question.reference: Transformer Secondary Voltage = 120 / 4 = 30 V; Transformer Polarity is additive; Voltmeter Reading = 120 + 30 = 150 V.

question.text: Which one of the following diagrams is correct for a Delta - Wye Transformer Configuration?
What is the current flow in one of the coils in the diagram?
question.reference: Delta configuration = I(line) = I(phase) / v3 = 30 / 1.73 = 17.3 A.

question.text: A 3-phase delta connected transformer bank consists of three 100 kVA transformers. One of the transformers develops a problem and has to be taken out of service for repairs. The other two transformers are remaining in service. What is the capacity of the transformer bank in kVA?
question.reference: Please refer to Open Delta kVA Capacity = ( 3-phase kVA capacity) / √3 = (3 x 100) / 1.73 = 173.4.

question.text: You have to size a transformer for a load of 45 amps at 480 volts, three-phase, 3-wire, what size of transformer is needed?
question.reference: Minimum kVA = (E(Line) x I(Line) x 1.73/ 1000 = 480 x 45 x 1.73/ 1000 = 37.5 kVA.

question.text: When a 600-120/208 volt, 3-phase, 4-wire transformer is delivering 100 amp in the secondary line conductors, how much current is flowing in one of the secondary phase windings?
When a 600-120/208 volt, 3-phase, 4-wire transformer is delivering 200 amp in the secondary line conductors, how much current is flowing in one of the secondary phase windings?
A power dry-type transformer is delivering high output voltage. How can this be corrected?
question.reference: Raising the primary tap increases the transformer primary to secondary ratio, thus reducing the output voltage.

question.text: You have a transformer that has a ratio of 5:1 and is hooked up Delta-Wye. If 600 volts is applied to the primary, what is the output line-to-neutral voltage on the secondary?
question.reference: Please refer to Secondary Winding Voltage - 600 / 5 = 120;.

question.text: What does "X"represent on a transformer diagram?
You have a transformer that has a ratio of 5:1 and is hooked up Delta-Wye. If 480 volts is applied to the primary, what is the output line-to-line voltage on the secondary?
question.reference: Please refer to Secondary Winding Voltage = 480 / 5 = 96; Secondary Line-to-Line Voltage = 96 x 1.73 = 166 V.

question.text: Using a voltmeter, what reading would you get across the terminals of an energized 2-pole circuit breaker installed in a 125 A, 120/240 volt, 1-phase panel?
You have two transformers having a rating of 50 kVA each at 2300 V. If the transformers are connected in a open delta configuration, what is the rating of the transformer configuration?
question.reference: Total kVA of Transformer bank = 50 x 2 = 100; Total kVA of open delta configuration = 86.6% of total kVA of transformer bank; Open Delta kVA rating = 100 x 0.866 = 86.6.

question.text: What is the minimum secondary equipment ampacity rating that may be used before secondary overcurrent protection is required for a 150 kVA, dry-type, 600 V-120/208 V, 3-phase, 3-phase, 4-wire transformer?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 26-256(1); Secondary Winding Amps = (150 x 1000) / (208 x 1.73) = 416.9; and Minimum Secondary Conductor Amps = 416.9 x 1.25 = 521 A.

question.text: What is the minimum size of R90XLPE conductor that can be installed in a run of EMT that is used to connect to the secondary of a 150 kVA, dry-type, 600 V-120/208 V, 3-phase, 4-wire transformer?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-006(2) and 26-258(2) and Table 2; Secondary Amps - (150 x 1000) / (208 x 1.73) = 416.9; Minimum Secondary Conductor Amps - 416.9 x 1.25 = 521; Conductor Size - 750 R90XLPE.

question.text: What is the minimum size of RW90XLPE conductor that can be installed in a run of EMT that is used to feed the primary of a 150 kVA, dry-type, 600 - 120/208 V, 3-phase, 4-wire transformer terminated?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-006(2) and 26-258(1) and Table 2; Primary Amps - (150 x 1000) / (600 x 1.73) = 144.5; Minimum Primary Conductor Amps - 144.5 x 1.25 = 180.6; Minimum conducttor size - #2/0.

question.text: What is the minimum size of the grounding conductor for a 112.5 kVA, dry-type, 600 V - 120/208 V, 3-phase, 4-wire transformer, when the transformer's secondary conductor type is RW90XLPE in a run of PVC conduit?
What is the minimum size of RW90XLPE conductor that can be installed in a run of EMT that is used to feed the secondary of a 75 kVA, dry-type, 600-120/208 V transformer?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-006(2) and 26-258 (2) and Table 2; Secondary Winding Amps - (75 x 1000) / (208 x 1.73) = 208.4 A; Minimum Secondary Conductor Amps - 208.4 x 1.25 = 260.5 A; Conductor size 250 RW90XLPE.

question.text: What is the minimum size of RW90XLPE conductor that can be installed in a run of EMT that is used to connect to the secondary of a 112.5 kVA, dry-type, 600 -120/208 V transformer to a circuit breaker?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-006(1) and 26-258(2) and Table 2; Secondary Winding Amps - (112.5 x 1000) / (208 x 1.73) = 312.6 A; Minimum Secondary Conductor Amps = 312.6 x 1.25 = 390.8 A; Conductor size - 600 kcmil RW90XLPE.

question.text: What is the minimum size of RW90XLPE conductor that can be installed in a run of EMT that is used to feed the primary of a 75 kVA, dry-type, 600-120/208 V transformer protected by a moulded case circuit breaker?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-006(1) and 26-258(1) and Table 2; Primary Amps - (75 x 1000) / (600 x 1.73) = 72.3; Minimum Primary Conductor Amps - 72.3 x 1.25 = 90.3; Conductor Size - #3 RW90XLPE.

question.text: What is the minimum size of RW90XLPE conductor that can be installed in a run of EMT that is used to feed the primary of a 112.5 kVA, dry-type, 600-120/208 V transformer?
question.reference: Please refer to Rules 4-006(2) and 26-258(1) and Table 2; Primary Amps - (112.5 x 1000) / (600 x 1.73) = 108.4 A; Minimum Primary Conductor Amps - 108.4 x 1.25 = 135.5 A; Conductor Size - #1 RW90XLPE.

question.text: A 3-phase transformer bank consists of three 37.5 kVA, 600 V, 1-phase transformers with no marked temperature rating. What is the minimum size of RW90(XLPE) line conductor that can be used, in a run of flexible metal conduit, to feed the 3-phase transformer bank?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 4-006 and 26-258(1)(a) and Table 2; Total kVA of 3-phase transformer bank = 37.5 x 3 = 112.5; Primary Winding Ampacity = (3-phase kVA x 1000) / (E(line) x 1.73) = (112.5 x 1000) / (600 x 1.73) = 108.25; Minimum primary conductor ampacity = 108.25 x 1.25 = 135.3A; Table 2 = #1 AWG.

question.text: A 3-phase transformer bank consists of three 15 kVA, 600 V, 1-phase transformers. What is the minimum size of T90 NYLON conductor that can be used to feed the transformer bank if the transformers are protected by a circuit breaker?
question.reference: Refer to Rules 4-006(1) and 26-258(1) and Table 2; Total kVA - 15 x 3 = 45; Primary ampacity - (3-phase kVA x 1000) / (E(Line) x v3) = (45 x 1000) / (600 x 1.73) = 43.3A; Minimum conductor size = 43.3 x 1.25 = 54.2 A; Conductor Size - #6 T90 NYLON.

question.text: A 3-phase Delta/Wye transformer bank consists of 3 - 25 kVA, 600-120/240 V, 1-phase transformers. What is the minimum size of RW90XLPE conductor that can be used to feed the 3-phase transformer bank if it is fed from a circuit breaker?

question.reference: Rule 12-1014(4) and Tables 10, 8 and 9 Cross-sectional area of #6 TW75  - 46.73 mm², Table 10 Total cross-sectional area of all #6 TW75 - 46.73 x 4 =186.92 mm² Cross-sectional area of #3 T90 Nylon - 62.83 mm², Table 10 Total cross-sectional area of all #3 T90 Nylon - 62.83 x 4 = 251.32 ² Total cross-sectional area of all conductors - 186.92 + 251.32 = 438.24 mm² % conduit fill - 40%, Table 8 Minimum size of conduit - 41, Table 9

question.text: What is the minimum size of rigid PVC conduit required to enclose the following conductors: 4 - #00 TW75 and 4 - #4 T90 Nylon conductors?
question.reference: Rule 12-1014(4) and Tables 10, 8 and 9 Cross-sectional area of #00 TW75  -  169.8 mm², Table 10 Total cross-sectional area of all #00 TW75 -  169.8 x 4 = 679.2 mm² Cross-sectional area of #4 T90 Nylon -  53.23 mm², Table 10 Total cross-sectional area of all #4 T90 Nylon -  53.23 x 4 = 212.92 mm² Total cross-sectional area of all conductors -  679.2 + 212.92 = 892.12 mm² % conduit fill -  40%, Table 8 Minimum size of conduit -  63, Table 9

question.text: What is the minimum size of rigid PVC conduit required to enclose the following conductors: 4 - 500 kcmil RW90XLPE and 4 - #6 T90 Nylon conductors?
question.reference: Rule 12-1014(4) and Tables 10, 8 and 9 Cross-sectional area of 500 kcmil RW90XLPE -  450.5 mm², Table 10 Total cross-sectional area of all 500 kcmil RW90XLPE -  450.5 x 4 = 1802 mm² Cross-sectional area of #6 T90 Nylon -  32.71 mm², Table 10 Total cross-sectional area of all #6 T90 Nylon -  32.71 x 4 = 130.84 mm² Total cross-sectional area of all conductors -  1802 + 130.84 = 1932.84 mm² % conduit fill -  40%, Table 8 Minimum size of conduit -  91, Table 9

question.text: What is the minimum size of EMT required to enclose the following conductors: 14 - #12 RW90XLPE, 32 - #10 RW90EP and 24 - #14 T90 Nylon conductors?
question.reference: Rule 12-1014(4) and Tables 10, 8 and 9 Cross-sectional area of a #12 RW90XLPE -  11.61 mm², Table 10 Total cross-sectional area of all #12 RW90XLPE -  11.61 x 14 = 162.54 mm² Cross-sectional area of #10 RW90EP -  21.45 mm², Table 10 Total cross-sectional area of all #10 RW90EP -  21.45 x 32 = 686.4 mm² Cross-sectional area of #14 T90 Nylon -  6.18 mm², Table 10 Total cross-sectional area of all #10 RW90EP -  6.18 x 24 = 148.32 mm² Total cross-sectional area of all conductors -  162.54 + 686.4 + 148.32 = 997.26 mm² % conduit fill -  40%, Table 8 Minimum size of conduit -  63, Table 9

question.text: What is the maximum ampacity rating for 3 - 350 kcmil RW90XLPE conductors in run of rigid metal conduit where the ambient temperature is 45 ºC?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 4-006(2) and Tables 2, and 5A. Ampacity rating of 350 kcmil RW90XLPE -  350 A, Table 2 Correction factor for 45 º -  0.87; Conductor ampacity - 350 x 0.87 = 304.5.

question.text: What is the maximum ampacity rating for 6 - 350 kcmil RW90XLPE conductors in a run of rigid metal conduit?
question.reference: Pleaswe refer to Rule 4-004(1)(c) and Tables 2 and 5C; Ampacity rating of 350 kcmil RW90XLPE - 350 A; correction facor - 0.8; Ampacity of conductor - 350 X 0.8 = 280 A.

question.text: What is the maximum ampacity rating for 9 - 350 kcmil RW90XLPE conductors in run of rigid metal conduit and terminated on circuit breakers in an ambient temperature of 45ºC?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 4-006(1) and Tables 2, 5A and 5C; Ampacity rating of 350 -  310 A; Correction factor for 45 ºC ambient temperature -  0.82; Correction factor conductors in a conduit - 0.7; Ampacity of conductor - 310 x 0.82 x 0.7 = 177.9.

question.text: What is the maximum distance that pull boxes can be kept apart when running rigid PVC conduit between them before an expansion joint is required where the temperature range is expected to be -30 degree C to 39 degree C?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 12-1118 and Appendix B Note; and Length of run = Max length of expansion / (temperature range x coefficient) = 45 / ([-30 + 39] x .052) = 12.5 m.

question.text: A junction box contains thirty-eight #10 RW90(XLPE) conductors. If all of the conductors are joined in pairs, which of the boxes listed below is the minimum size that can be used?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 12-3034 and Table 22; Size of Conductors = #10; Number of insulated conductors = 38; Number of wire connectors = 38 / 2 = 19; Number of extra conductors = 19 / 2 = 9.5; Total number of conductors = 38 + 9 = 47; Volume of #10 = 36.9 mL (Table 22); Total Volume of Conductors or Minimum volume of box = 47 x 36.9 = 1734.3 mL; Volume in cubic inches = 1734.3 x .061 = 105.8 cubic inches; and Volume of 6 x 6 x 4 box = 6 x 6 x 4 = 144 cubic inches.

question.text: The following conductors are to be joined in pairs in a junction box to extend circuits as a result of changes to the building: twelve #8 R90(XLPE); eight #10 R90(XLPE); sixteen #12 R90(XLPE); What is the minimum volume of the junction box?
question.reference: #8 R90(XLPE): Total number of conductors = 12 + 3 = 15; Total Volume = 45.1 x 15 = 676.5 mm³; #10 R90(XLPE): Total number of conductors = 8 + 2 = 10; Total Volume = 36.9 x 10 = 369 mm³; #12 R90(XLPE): 16 + 4 = 20; Total Volume = 28.7 x 20 = 574 mm³; Total Volume of box = 676.5 + 369 + 574 = 1619.5 mm³; Volume of box in cubic inches = 1619.5 x .061 = 98.79. Please refer to 12-3036 (1) & (2) & Table 22, Conductor Space in Boxes for clarification

question.text: What is the smallest size of device box (in inches) that can be used for four #10 R90(XLPE) and two #14 R90(XLPE) conductors?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 12-3034 and Tables 22 and 23. Volume of #10 = 36.9 mL (Table 22); Volume of #14 = 24.6 mL (Table 22); Total Volume of Conductors = (36.9 X4) + (24.6 x 2) = 14

question.text: The following conductors are to be joined in pairs in a junction box to extend circuits as a result of changes to a building: ten #8 R90(XLPE); twenty #10 R90(XLPE); thirty #12 R90(XLPE). What is the minimum volume of the box in cubic inches that can be used as the junction box?
question.reference: #8 R90(XLPE): Total number of conductors = 10 + 2 = 12; Total Volume = 45.1 x 12 = 541.2 mm³; #10 R90(XLPE): Total number of conductors = 20 + 5 = 25; Total Volume = 36.9 x 25 = 922.5 mm³; #12 R90(XLPE): 30 + 7 = 37; Total Volume = 28.7 x 37 = 1061.9 mm³; Total Volume of box = 541.2 + 922.5 + 1061.9 = 2525.6 mm³; Volume of box in cubic inches = 2525.6 x .061 = 154.06. Please refer to Rule 12-3034(1) & (2) & Table 22.

question.reference: Please refer to Rule 4-006, 8-102 and Table D3. To calculate Voltage Drop: Total Electric Heat Load = 2000 + 1500 = 3500 W; Total Electric Heat load in Amps = 3500 / 240 = 14.6 A; Distance = TBD3 Value x % drop x distance correction factor (DCF) x voltage/120; Note: DCF comes from table in Note 3 of Table D3 and is based on % of allowable ampacity =(demand load/conductor ampacity) x 100 and is chosen from the 75ºC column due to the breaker termination; Distance = 6.1 x 3 x 1.06 x 240/120 = 38.8m

question.reference: Please refer to Rule 4-006, 8-102 and Table D3. To calculate Voltage Drop: Total Electric Heat Load = 1000 + 1500 = 2500 W; Total Electric Heat load in Amps = 2500 / 240 = 10.4 A; Distance = TBD3 Value x % drop x distance correction factor (DCF) x voltage /120; Note: DCF comes from table in Note 3 of Table D3 and is based on % of allowable ampacity =(demand load/conductor ampacity) x 100 (the 75ºC column must be used due to the breaker termination); Distance = 4.9 x 3 x 1.07 x 240/120 = 31.5m

question.text: A heat pump rated at 20 amps, 240 volts, single-phase is installed 6 m from its supply. What is the minimum size of RW90(XLPE) conductor required that would not allow more than a 2% voltage drop?

question.text: A junction box contains 32 - #10 RW90XLPE and 26 #14 T90NYLON conductors. If all of the conductors are joined in pairs, which of the boxes listed below is the minimum size that can be used?
question.reference: Table 22; Usable space required for the conductors = (32 x 36.9) + (26 x 24.6) = 1820.4 mL; mL to cubic inches (from conversion chart on p. xxix) 1820.4 x 0.061 = 111 cubic inches of space required; A 6 x 6 x 4 box has 144 cubic inches of space, and is the smallest size available for the installation.

question.text: A 'E' box contains 52 - #12 RW90XLPE conductors. If all of the conductors are joined in pairs, which of the boxes listed below is the minimum size that can be used?
question.reference: Rule 12-3034 and Table 22; Each #12 requires 28.7mL of space inside the enclosure and each pair of wire connectors is counted as a conductor, making the total number of "wires" 52 + (26/2) = 65; 28.7 x 65 = 1865.5mL; The 15 x 15 x 15 box has a volume of 3375mL and is the smallest box of the options given that may be used for this installation.

Two 240 V electric baseboard heaters (2000 W & 1750 W) are to be protected by a common circuit breaker. What is the maximum distance that at 12/2 NMD90 can be run for this circuit?
question.reference: Rule 4-006, 8-102, 62-114, Table 2 and Table D3 Demand Load = connected load or 80% of the overcurrent protection, whichever is smaller; Connected load = (2000 + 1750) / 240 = 15.625 80% of Overcurrent protection = 20 x 0.8 = 16A: Distance Correction Factor (DCF) = Table value based on demand load/conductor ampacity x 100 = 15.625/25 x 100 = 62.5 (round up to 70% column - 75°C row used due to breaker termination) Distance a 12/2 cable can run = TBD3 Value x %drop x DCF x system voltage / 120 Distance = 6.1 x 3 x 1.03 x 240/120 = 37.7m

A panel supplies a 2500 W baseboard heater. If the wiring method was 14/2 NMD90, on a 240 V supply, what is the maximum distance the heater can be installed from the panel when protected by a circuit breaker?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 4-006, 8-102 and Table D3. To calculate Voltage Drop: Total Electric Heat Load = 2500 W; Total Electric Heat load in Amps = 2500 / 240 = 10.42 A; Distance = TBD3 Value x % drop x distance correction factor (DCF) x voltage/120; Note: DCF comes from table in Note 3 of Table D3 and is based on % of allowable ampacity =(demand load/conductor ampacity) x 100 and is chosen from the 75ºC column due to the breaker termination; Distance = 4.9 x 3 x 1.06 x 240/120 = 31.16m

question.text: A heat pump rated at 40 amps, 240 volts, 3-phase is installed 90 m from its supply. What is the minimum size of R90(XLPE) conductor required, that would not allow more than a 3% voltage drop?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 28-106(1), 4-006 and Table D3; Motor's FLA = 40 A (from question); Minimum Conductor Amps = 40 x 1.25 = 50 A (Rule 28-106(1)); To estimate conductor size needed; Estimate Table D3 Value = (distance x 120) / ( %drop x 1 x system voltage); Table D3 Value = (90 x 120) / (3 x 1 x 240); Table D3 Value = 15m Table D3 Value of 15.6m for a 40A load indicates a #4 AWG conductor will be needed; Check to see if a #4 AWG will travel 90m; Distance = Table D3 Value x %drop allowed x DCF x system voltage/120 (Note: DCF is based on (demand load/conductor ampacity) x 100; the 90ºC row of the Distance Correction Factor table will be used in this question because there is no indication of a marked termination temperature); Distance = 15.6 x 3 x 1.06 x 240/120 = 99.2m This confirms that a #4 AWG conductor is large enough to supply a 40A load 90m away

question.text: A heat pump rated at 40 amps, 240 volts, 1-phase is installed 70 m from its supply.  What is the minimum size of R90(XLPE) conductor required, that would not allow more than a 3% voltage drop?
question.reference: Please refer to Rule 28-106(1), Tables 2 and D3; Motor's FLA = 40 A (from question); Minimum Conductor Amps = 40 x 1.25 = 50 A; Conductor Size - #8 AWG; Distance to Load for #8 at 40 A at 1 % voltage drop = 6.2 m; Ampacity of #8 R90(XLPE) = 55 A; Maximum Voltage Drop = 3 %; Conductor Load Percentage = 40/55 = 72.7 %; Distance Correction Factor = 1.00; Load Voltage = 240 V; Maximum length for #8 = 6.2 x 3 x 1.00 x (240/120) = 37.2 m; Since the #8 can only be used for a maximum distance of 37.2  m, the conductor size has to be increased; Repeat the calculation for the next size larger conductor = # 6 R90(XLPE). Conductor Size - #6 AWG; Distance to Load for #6 at 40 A at 1 % voltage drop = 9.8 m; Ampacity of #6 R90(XLPE) = 75 A; Conductor Load Percentage = 40/75 = 53.3 %; Distance Correction Factor = 1.04; Maximum length for #6 = 9.8 x 3 x 1.04 x (240/120) = 61.2 m; Since the #6 can only be used for a maximum distance of 61.2  m, the conductor size has to be increased,  Repeat the calculation for the next size larger #4 R90(XLPE); Conductor Size - #4 AWG; Distance to Load for #4 at 40 A at 1 % voltage drop = 15.6 m ; Ampacity of #4 R90(XLPE) = 95 A; Conductor Load Percentage = 40/95 = 42.1 %; Distance Correction Factor = 1.06; Maximum length for #4 = 15.6 x 3 x 1.06 x (240/120) = 99.2 m; Since the maximum  length allowed for a #4 R90(XLPE) exceeds 70 m, the answer is a #4 R90(XLPE)

question.text: What is the maximum size of time-limit type circuit breaker that can be used to protect a 5 hp, 208 V, 1-phase refrigeration compressor?

question.text: A 15 hp, 600 V, 3-phase refrigeration compressor keeps tripping the maximum standard rated time-limit type circuit breaker on startup. What is the maximum size the time-limit type circuit breaker that can be increased to so that the compressor will start
